attributes.action: STOP THE NHS THROWING UNOPENED PRESCRIBED DRUGS AWAY
attributes.additional_details: NHS ARE WASTING MONEY WITH A POLICY TO THROW AWAY MEDICATION THAT WAS WRONGLY DISPENSED. WHENPATIENTS RETURN THEM TO THE CHEMIST NOT OPEN OR TAMPERED WITH THEY GET THROWN AWAY. THIS IS A BLATANT WASTE OF MONEY ON THE NHS SIDE
attributes.background: DRUGS ARE BEING THROWN AWAY BY PHARMACIES WHEN THEY ARE DISPENSED WRONGLY AND THE PATIENT HAS TORETURN THEM UNOPENED AND NOT USED

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about whether to re-use medication returned by patients are a matter for individual NHS facilities, not the UK Government or Parliament.
